reviews.review_msg: Took this course with Cherie in Spring 2025. Enthusiastic and caring prof. Exams and assignments are based on lectures which are great at teaching concepts in a clear and concise way. If you're in a math-heavy major such as statistics, this course should be a breeze. Even if you're not, the math in this course is pretty easy to understand.
Cherie was super enthusiastic and lectures were quite enjoyable. All assessments were 100% fair, if you keep up with everything, this class is very straightforward. Highly recommend this course

This course is quite content heavy, but Cherie did a great job breaking down concepts and making them manageable. I took ACMA101 with her in Spring 2024 and it was a good experience. Make sure to study key vocabulary terms, as those are free marks on exams if you memorized them. Fair bit of memorization, but not bad. Fun course!
She is the best teacher ever in ACMA course.

Extremely nice and enthusiastic prof. Her course is very hair as exams and assignments are based directly off of the notes and she also includes some interactive activities in the course. 10/10 would recommend taking this course with Cherie.
Great Professor! Fair marker and easily accessible outside of class. She uploads all of her lecture notes which are really easy to follow along.

Cherie was amazing this semester and was always ready to help during office hours. ACMA 101 was difficult but the course definitely would have been more difficult without her. Highly recommend actually attending and listening during lecture rather than relying on notes uploaded by Cherie.
Unorganized. Can be rude at times.

Cherie is all around a great person and professor. She always goes out of her way to explain her concepts clearly and concisely, and her assignments and exams are based off of the concepts and practice questions covered in lecture!

Cherie is a great Prof to take ACMA 101 with. Her exams are very fair and based off the assignments we did in each unit. She is also very caring and goes out of her way to engage with the class during lectures. Her lectures are clear, concise, and easy to follow. Would strong recommend anyone take a course with her!
Cherie is awesome.

Cherie is a great Prof. Her lectures are super clear and she explains concepts thoroughly, and she goes at a pace that makes it easy for students to follow along. She's also quite funny at times. Assignments and exams sometimes take a while to get returned though, and the grading can be a bit disorganized. Overall a good experience.

Dr. Lu's course is full of text-heavy lectures. The slides are posted in-advance, however, attending lectures is required to see solutions to the problems in the notes. Assignments and exams are very fair; they only ever contained problems from the notes or tutorials. For exams, knowing some facts and definitions is important to get easy marks.

Professor Lu makes ACMA 101 a very inaccessible & hard class. It's impossible to get the notes from her and she won't let you take pictures of the annotated slides. She doesn't explain answers you've gotten wrong and does a horrible job on elaborating anything. Your best luck is to not take the class if you can or get a good study group.

You have to attend all the dry and text-heavy lectures. If you miss one, the completed notes aren't uploaded so it becomes hard to comprehend. If you miss a tutorial, the tutorial answers aren't uploaded. If you want to study past assignments or midterms, the solutions aren't uploaded. The canvas page is purely just for announcements and handouts.

Really, really sweet person. Genuinely wants her students to do well. Lectures can get a bit tedious but it's easier if you watch it after in 2x speed. Overall, if you pay attention and do assignments, you'll do well. You can ask her anything she's super nice and will try her best to help you.
very dry lectures, she reads word for word from slides, but slides are very wordy. do not take course unless acturial student. assignments are quite lengthy.

Very caring professor. Helps you with all the questions you have when you show up at her office hour, and gives really decent clues to let you figure out. The midterms and finals are fair as it correlates to the assignments. Would strongly recommend.

Dr. Lu has been incredibly helpful to the class and cares about each student's success in the course. All the assignments are very straightforward, no surprises and all notes and tutorials based. The midterms and finals are all straightforward as well. Wished I asked for help for a few questions early on to get an A in the class!

Anytime I sent an email to ask questions she would reply and tried to have a small zoom meeting just for me, to explain my questions. She did gave us assignments but they are very helpful. The materials in class are clear. All the things she gave on test were from assignments and class notes. If you studied, you will get good grades if you studied.
Really caring the student success.
Covers an excessive amount of material that you will never be tested on. Each lecture feels painful when you must listen to every word she reads off the slides.

Professor Lu spent a lot of time reading the notes she posted instead of making them readings leading to really dry lectures. You can't skip lectures because she goes over how to do some problems you wouldn't know how to do otherwise. Tutorials, assignments and tests were all related. The exams weren't too bad if you study the problems.

First semester ACMA101 is offered and I thought I would learn about insurance... if you aren't interested in actuary science or don't ha e a background in the field, good luck. Hard to understand, doesn't let you take pictures of the lecture notes .
